column5: I haven't been on WC for a while and I missed that you were sick. I'm glad you've recovered. Take it easy my friend. I hope to fish with you someday. To your full recovery and good health! Cheers!
Hi Mike So glad you are feeling better.

Just logged on and saw this post. Am equal parts touched and mildly embarrassed. Thanks for the support guys, honestly!I really did feel like I was dying last week LOL! I'm still in pain and not eating much, but I can deal with that, and yes, I did fish last week.Was probably a much needed wake up call for me, as I really do need to change my diet and lifestyle at least a little.Getting older sucks!
Not being able to get old would suck more.

Mike, Just saw the title tonight, i have not been here in quite some time and glad to hear you are much better. Looking forward to the many great fishing stories from you in the future. Best regards and take care. Brian
For the past several years one of my mantras has been:"Getting old doesn't bother me, but being old is really inconvenient".Pooch
Get well soon Mike! Reflux is bad enough. I can't imagine adding and ulcer to it.
Get well quickly ! You bring a LOT of joy to a LOT of people !
Glad to see you got treatment and I am praying for a speedy recovery. Thanks for all you do, Mike Hooks
Take care of yourself Mike & here's to a quick recovery.
Hoping you a speedy recovery Mike! Andrew
Gut trouble is NO FUN! I hope you feel better soon and are back smacking walleyes and big pike in no time.
Get well so we can see more adventures !
Wishing Solo a quick recovery
Get well soon my friend!
Get better Mike TC.
He's fishing already with Brendan and some buddies.
Mike Borger posted on his Facebook Page " Looks like No Fishing for a While. Drove myself to emergency earlier tonight and I'm not doing particularly great" Get well Mike!!
For those of us that don't have facebook, please keep us posted.Best of wishes go to him.Pooch

Greetings, I don't follow FaceBook either, so please keep us up to date on Mike's situation. I hope he and his son are out chucking Doctor Spoons in the upcoming season, as many of us very much enjoy reading his articles. Good fishing and tight lines!!

From Mike's FB page: "Wow, so much love from my friends I'm touched. Just a quick update. Since Friday I've been dealing with severe abdominal pains and vomiting. Haven't been able to hold down and food or water or sleep because the pain was too brutal. Finally went to the Hospital at 3am this morning and surprisingly they didn't waste a ton of time to test me. They did bloodwork, chest x ray and cat scan. In the end I think it could have been worse. It's nothing contagious at least. Apparently I developed a pretty bad ulcer and the worst case of acid reflux the doc has ever seen. So despite the fact it still feels like someone's stabbing my gut I suspect I'll live. And if the prescription they gave me actually works to alleviate the pain and nausea, I may even still go fishing on Wednesday"
Mike - I hope you an Brendan are out steelheading this weekend.
Hope you have a speedy recovery Mike. Thank God you weren't on one your far north trips
Sounds like fairly good news.All the best.
A speedy return to good health and the **** out of the hospital, Mike!
Please take care of yourself, Mike. I love reading about your fishing adventures.
This is really a bad news
